00090 typedef struct _CameraFile CameraFile;

00093 int gp_file_new_from_fd    (CameraFile **file, int fd);

00097 
00098 /* "Do not use those"
00099  *
00100  * These functions probably were originally intended for internal use only.
00101  * However, due to
00102  *   - the lack of good documentation
00103  *   - this being the obvious way to save a file
00104  *   - the fact that libgphoto2 has been exporting all its internal
00105  *     symbols for years (until 2005-06)
00106  *   - our in-house frontends gphoto2 and gtkam using them
00107  * a number of external frontends started to use these functions, as
00108  * of 2005-06:
00109  *    - digikam
00110  *    - f-spot
00111  *    - gthumb
00112  * But a few frontends can live without it (and thus are likely to
00113  * use the correct API):
00114  *    - flphoto
00115  *    - kamera
00116  *
00117  * So we're going to phase these functions out over the next year or
00118  * so, going the GTK way of keeping the ABI but breaking the API. So
00119  * we'll continue to export functionally equivalent functions, but the
00120  * header files will not contain definitions for you to use any more.
00121  */
00122 int gp_file_open           (CameraFile *file, const char *filename);
00123 int gp_file_save           (CameraFile *file, const char *filename);
00124 int gp_file_clean          (CameraFile *file);
00125 int gp_file_copy           (CameraFile *destination, CameraFile *source);
00126 
00127 int gp_file_set_name       (CameraFile *file, const char  *name);
00128 int gp_file_get_name       (CameraFile *file, const char **name);

00131 int gp_file_get_mime_type  (CameraFile *file, const char **mime_type);
